title: FUBAR music html problem
content:
I put music on my profile page on FUBAR.Com. I change the music each week. I have used FIREFOX there for two years or so with no problems.

Today I changed the HTML (supplied by YouTube) for the music but when I look at my profile page I get an error message that says I need to be signed in to insure I'm not a bot (a post from YouTube). After a lot of discussion it was found out that when other users view my page they see and hear the music video just fine!!??

What's the problem> FUBAR support says it's FireFox???

PLEASE HELP ME I don't want to go to a microfrost browser!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I'm running WIN 10 and will stay there! Thanks Donnie
creator: smilingdon

title: GPG issue trying to install FireFox on Debian 12 for Debian-based distributions in a Docker image
content:
I am following the procedure outlined here at:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/install-firefox-linux#w_install-firefox-deb-package-for-debian-based-distributions-recommended

I get this error when I run the gpg command

2:05:29:490 1>#8 [base 5/8] RUN gpg -n -q --import --import-options import-show /etc/apt/keyrings/packages.mozilla.org.asc | awk '/pub/{getline; gsub(/^ +| +$/,""); if($0 == "35BAA0B33E9EB396F59CA838C0BA5CE6DC6315A3") print " The key fingerprint matches ("$0"). "; else print " Verification failed: the fingerprint ("$0") does not match the expected one. "}' 22:05:29:567 1>#8 0.285 gpg: keyblock resource '/home/.gnupg/pubring.kbx': No such file or directory 22:05:29:567 1>#8 0.285 gpg: no valid OpenPGP data found.

I am not familiar with Linux and I thought that following the instructions would work so I am asking for help.

Here is the complete script.

RUN wget -q https://packages.mozilla.org/apt/repo-signing-key.gpg -O- | tee /etc/apt/keyrings/packages.mozilla.org.asc > /dev/null RUN gpg -n -q --import --import-options import-show /etc/apt/keyrings/packages.mozilla.org.asc | awk '/pub/{getline; gsub(/^ +| +$/,""); if($0 == "35BAA0B33E9EB396F59CA838C0BA5CE6DC6315A3") print " The key fingerprint matches ("$0"). "; else print " Verification failed: the fingerprint ("$0") does not match the expected one. "}' RUN echo "deb [signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/packages.mozilla.org.asc] https://packages.mozilla.org/apt mozilla main" | tee -a /etc/apt/sources.list.d/mozilla.list > /dev/null RUN echo ' Package: * Pin: origin packages.mozilla.org Pin-Priority: 1000 ' | tee /etc/apt/preferences.d/mozilla RUN apt-get update && apt-get install firefox

Thank you.
creator: serge_lamarre

title: Firefox will not route audio to the 3.5 mm jack on my desktop (Lenovo ThinkCentre M720e SFF).
content:
This issue came up in early April 2025.

Programs other than Firefox (e.g. Edge, Media Player) behave normally: when playing sound, if nothing is plugged into the 3.5 mm jack, the sound comes from the desktop's external speakers; and when an audio device (speakers or headphones) is plugged into the 3.5 mm jack, the sound instead comes from that device.

Where as Firefox will play using the internal speakers as expected, but when a device is plugged into the 3.5 mm jack, no sound signal goes to that device.

It seems then that the hardware is okay, and the problem must lie within Firefox, or within a Windows setting that is very specific to Firefox.

The sudden onset earlier this month may point to either a Firefox update, or (less likely) a Windows update.
creator: spope384
